full_text:
best scripted offenses so far this year:

-titans got a big boost playing the raiders last week
-panthers cardinals will be miserable
-the giants' run game takes time to get going

#nflverse https://t.co/vxuhUAIXUn

Here's the rate at which offenses have gone three and out through 3 weeks of the season. The Bears have been not good while the Eagles have been amazing.

#nflverse https://t.co/E0gSTP2cqd

Teams helped most by penalties (on a net basis) this year:

1) CHI (+2.7 expected points / game)
2) HOU (+2.6)
3) CIN (+2.6)
4) ATL (+2.4)
...
29) PHI (-2.6)
30) SF (-2.6)
31) SEA (-3.0)
32) DAL (-3.7)

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/sZ7xns5Jy7

Here's the offensive Snap Count pillboxes chart for KC vs IND. Interestingly, all but 1 of Watsons snaps were pass plays, while only three of Moore's snaps were pass plays. Fortson also not used as a run blocker. 

#nflverse #rstats #ggplot2 https://t.co/VAjrAKYlqb

Here's KC's defense chart. Brian Cook in almost exclusively on third down pass plays. Chenal pretty much only on run plays. They were never on the field at the same time. I find that interesting. 

#nflverse #rstats #ggplot2 https://t.co/9FbSSgZVmz

Here's the same data for the Colts on offense and defense. 

#nflverse #rstats #ggplot2 https://t.co/U21sWoHsKd

Through 3 weeks, the Ravens have run 11 personnel on less than 11% of plays.
Next lowest is ATL w/ 19% and then CLE w/ 43%.
#nflverse https://t.co/FsmQRTsN94

best scripted offenses so far this year:

-titans got a big boost playing the raiders last week
-panthers cardinals will be miserable
-the giants' run game takes time to get going

#nflverse https://t.co/vxuhUAIXUn

Ahead of tonight's #TNF matchup let's look at how offenses performed on a play-by-play level (EPA) and on a series-by-series level (SSR) so far.

We're going to see two completely different offenses tonight.

#nflverse https://t.co/Cty6N4z59x
@friscojosh #nflverse

@JoeBucsFan Enjoyed the show as always @JoeBucsFan!  On the discussion about dropped passes and are they a big issue - thought you would like this graphic. Shows Bucs have lost 22 expected points from drops (EPA) in two games.
Data: #nflverse & Sportradar https://t.co/ZnAlX6KtrG

#nfl week 3 starts tonight with my favorite squad @steelers...expected to lose to the Browns?  Well, at least according to my model - let's dive into last week's performance, the current projections, and this week's predictions #nflverse
This is why I love simulation in the #nflverse!

This week, the model loves the @ChicagoBears (!) and is uncertain about the high-flying @Eagles.  I don't like rooting against my creation in tonights game, but so it goes #herewego #rstats #nflverse https://t.co/niUs2xAvHT

Here's the detailed snap counts breakdown for Kansas City vs Los Angeles. Note that this does NOT include kneel down plays (because who cares who was on the field for those!), so these numbers will differ slightly from the official numbers. 

#nflverse #rstats #ggplot2 https://t.co/Qx64tsVLOh

Here's the formations for the Chiefs in their loss to Indy yesterday. 86% of our snaps were in 11 or 12 personnel. Fortson is just not seeing much use. Skyy got 8 real snaps this week. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/WSGjUOs6zk

Here's the defense. 72% of the snaps were in 4-2-5 or 3-3-5. Jones and George the ironmen on the line. Chenal with 10 total snaps (14%). Harris definitely in the Willie Gay role. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/AMojb3E1Ds

From 1999 to 2021, teams that had a 4th quarter lead of more than 14 points were 2618-33-3 (0.987)

In the first two weeks of 2022, those teams are 14-3-1 (0.806)

Data: #nflverse

The Browns collapsed against the Jets on Sunday, giving up a 13-point lead in the last two minutes. They have now given up three of the four latest >10-point leads since 1999.

Here is every team that has blown a >10-point lead in the final four mins since 1999.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/APjOCTLWtx
Last season I published a lookup table that joins sportradar play-by-play with #nflverse play-by-play. I'll be doing the same this year: https://t.co/QzA0xMW2oC

Here's how every NFL team's offense has performed on scripted (x-axis) & non-scripted plays (y-axis) so far in 2022

#nflverse https://t.co/IjQ82r3P6W

Using the new participation data from @nflfastR we can see how predictable teams are running/passing out of certain personnel packages so far through 2 weeks using pass rate over expected as a proxy. Could be other ways to see this but a fun exercise to go through

#nflverse https://t.co/VvkqcdCkaP

Here's the rate at which offenses have gone three and out through 3 weeks of the season. The Bears have been not good while the Eagles have been amazing.

#nflverse https://t.co/E0gSTP2cqd

This Sunday we had 3 of top-20 biggest turnarounds in Win Probability in 2nd half since 2006!
For sure, Jets - Browns game is the new top-1!

#nflverse #NFL https://t.co/rjkhoXCYwo

@YZR_Fantasy Annoyingly, the #nflverse data only has snap counts going back to 2013, so I had to manually type out the counts for Jackson and Maclin. I was too lazy to do that for the rest of the philly crew, and Conley is the only KC WR who would fit that criteria.
